cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest into the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then forecast to gradually curve north and northeast, crossing Florida’s Big Bend and emerging off the South-Atlantic coast late in the week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from the Keys to the Big Bend, then Georgia–South Carolina–North Carolina Atlantic coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low (≈3% chance of sustained 34-kt winds; breezy conditions possible late week)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Chesapeake Bay for this advisory
weather_observation.rainfall: Intermittent showers possible late week as the system passes well offshore; heavy totals not expected
